comment.text: The translation key "LdapSettingsSubjectName" is used to display the subject name of a certificate in a LDAP settings page. It appears as a paragraph within a Certificate Dialog, allowing users to view and verify the subject information. Translators should ensure that this text accurately reflects the organization's or entity's own name.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "اسم الموضوع" (ism al-mawdoo') is a literal translation of 'Subject name', it might not be the most natural or common way to refer to this setting in a technical context (LDAP settings). It implies the topic of the LDAP settings, rather than the subject identifier used in LDAP.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider alternatives like "اسم الفاعل" (ism al-fa'il) or "اسم المستخدم" (ism al-mustakhdim) which might be more appropriate depending on the precise meaning intended within the LDAP settings.  A more context-aware translation would be preferable to a strictly literal one.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "Mövzu adı" is a possible translation for "Subject name", it can be ambiguous. 'Subject' in this LDAP context likely refers to the name of the user or entity being identified, so a more accurate translation would be 'Istifadəçi adı' (User name) or 'Objekt adı' (Object name).
The translation 'Име на предмет' is a literal translation of 'Subject name' and is not the typical or expected terminology in a technical context. It could be misinterpreted.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A more appropriate translation in a technical context, particularly relating to LDAP settings, would be something like 'Име на обект' or 'Наименование на обект'.  Further context might clarify the best option.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While 'Name des Subjekts' is technically correct, it's a very literal translation and sounds unnatural in German for a setting label. 'Subjekt' often isn't used in this context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider 'Benutzername' or 'Name' depending on the exact meaning of 'Subject name' in the application.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While 'Nombre del sujeto' is literally 'Subject name', a more natural and common translation for a setting label like this would be 'Nombre del tema' or 'Nombre del asunto'. 'Sujeto' can have a specific legal/formal connotation that isn't intended here.
The translation includes a trailing space.

While "Nom du sujet" is technically correct, it's not the most natural or common translation for 'Subject name' in the context of LDAP settings.  'Nom du sujet' sounds a bit formal and might not be immediately clear to all users. A more common and understandable translation would be 'Nom du Sujet' (with a capital 'S').

While "주체 이름" is a literal translation of "Subject name", in the context of LDAP settings, a more appropriate translation would be "제목" or "이름". "주체" can have connotations beyond a simple name or title.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using "제목" or "이름" instead of "주체 이름".

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "Naam onderwerp" while technically correct, isn't the most natural or idiomatic translation of "Subject name" in the context of LDAP settings. "Onderwerp" can be a bit vague. A more accurate and common translation would depend on the specific context, but "Naam van de gebruiker" or "Gebruikersnaam" would be preferable.

The translation 'Nume de subiect' is not the most natural or accurate translation of 'Subject name' in the context of LDAP settings. 'Subiect' can imply 'subject' in the sense of 'topic' rather than 'name related to a subject'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider 'Nume subiectului' or 'Denumire subiectului' which are more aligned with 'Subject name' in this context.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Serbian (Cyrillic) translation "Број субјекта" translates to "Subject Number" which is not an accurate translation of "Subject name". "Subject name" refers to the name of the subject, not a numerical identifier.
The translation "Broj subjekta" (Number of subject) doesn't accurately reflect the meaning of "Subject name." It translates to 'Number of subject' instead of 'Subject name'.

While 'Özne adı' is a literal translation of 'Subject name', it's not the most natural or common way to refer to a subject name in a technical context, especially concerning LDAP settings. 'Konu adı' would be a more suitable and widely understood term in this scenario.

While "主题名称" (zhǔtí míngchēng) is technically a valid translation, it's not the most natural or common way to translate "Subject name" in the context of LDAP settings. It implies a 'topic name' rather than the name of a subject or person.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider alternatives like "主体名称" (zhǔtǐ míngchēng) or "姓名" (xìngmíng), depending on the specific LDAP setting. "主体名称" is likely the better fit.
